abstract.p: Top-ranked Martina Hingis defeats Anna Kournikova to capture women's Kremlin Cup in Moscow (S)

block.p: Top-ranked Martina Hingis beat Anna Kournikova, her doubles partner, 6-3, 6-1, to capture the women's Kremlin Cup in Moscow.

Hingis ran off five games in a row to finish the first set and take a 3-0 lead in the second, then allowed just one point in the final two games to close out her eighth title of the year and 34th career championship.
Top-ranked Martina Hingis beat Anna Kournikova, her doubles partner, 6-3, 6-1, to capture the women's Kremlin Cup in Moscow.

Hingis ran off five games in a row to finish the first set and take a 3-0 lead in the second, then allowed just one point in the final two games to close out her eighth title of the year and 34th career championship.
The loss kept Kournikova, a Russian who is one of the most popular players on the WTA Tour, without a tournament championship in her pro career. (AP)
KAFELNIKOV REPEATS IN MOSCOW: Second-seeded Yevgeny Kafelnikov of Russia defended his ATP men's Kremlin Cup title with a 6-2, 7-5 victory over unseeded David Prinosil of Germany.

Kafelnikov broke his opponent twice in the opening set and broke Prinosil in the 11th game of the second set en route to the victory. Prinosil had defeated Marat Safin of Russia, the United States Open winner, in the semifinals. (Agence France-Presse)

ENQVIST SCORES SWISS VICTORY: Thomas Enqvist of Sweden captured the Swiss Indoors at Basel, beating Roger Federer of Switzerland, 6-2, 4-6, 7-6 (4), 1-6, 6-1, for his second title of the year. Federer had been seeking the first ATP title of his career. (AP)
